article.headline: VILLANOVA 73, VIRGINIA 63
article.story: VILLANOVA, Pa. (AP) -- Allan Ray scored 23 points and Randy Foye added 21 to help Villanova beat Virginia 73-63 in the second round of the NIT on Saturday. The Wildcats (18-16), making their fifth straight appearance in the NIT, have won four of their last five games and will play the winner of the Rutgers-West Virginia game in the quarterfinals. Gary Forbes led Virginia (18-13) with 19 points, and Elton Brown scored all 13 of his points in the second half. Villanova led by as many as 17. The Cavaliers, who made 13 3-point field goals in their first- round win over George Washington, were only 1-of-10 from long range Saturday and did not make a 3-pointer until Derrick Byars hit one at the 5:15 mark to cut Villanova's lead to 56-50. The Cavaliers pulled within four points at 63-59 with 1:30 remaining, but Foye countered with a jumper. Will Sheridan blocked a shot and came up with a steal in the final minute, and Foye was 6-of-8 from the line down the stretch.< ^Boise St. 73, Wis.-Milwaukee 70= NAMPA, Idaho (AP) -- Aaron Haynes had 20 points and 12 rebounds, and Coby Karl made two free throws with 13 seconds left to lift Boise State past Wisconsin-Milwaukee in the first round. Boise State (23-9), which will play Marquette on Tuesday, led by 14 with 12:23 left before Wisconsin-Milwaukee (20-11) ran off 12 straight points to pull to 58-56 with 8:32 remaining. Dylan Page led Wisconsin-Milwaukee with 23 points.
